definitions.definition: a vehicle with special equipment, used for taking sick or injured people to a hospital

examples.text: The **ambulance crew** rushed her to the hospital.
An ambulance was sent to the scene of the accident.
Don't worry—the ambulance is on its way.
He was put into an ambulance and taken away.
He went in the ambulance with his father.

wordOrigin: early 19th cent.: French, from hôpital ambulant ‘mobile (horse-drawn) field hospital’, from Latin ambulant- ‘walking’, from ambulare.
